title: Subdomain takeover at info.hacker.one

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**

Hi team,i've been able to takeover subdomain at __info.hacker.one__,
the CNAME entry in the subdomain is pointing to an external page service (app.unbounce.com). 

#### Actual Dns Entry:

{F156764}


#### Steps To Reproduce

1) I have claimed the domain and placed a page for PoC validation located under: 
Go to -> http://info.hacker.one/blank-page-123133617adasdasdsa/
2) You see the alert box and the subdomain takeover

{F156765}

Private & hide Video PoC at -> https://youtu.be/IcoGM65YyU4


#### How was this possible?

While testing UnbouncePage services i saw that they block any domain that was already claimed, but i decided go  deeper and I found an 0day in their API which allows any user to claim any domain with a DNS entry pointing to -> __unbouncepages.com__, i think this bug compromises All Customers Domains at UnbouncePage Services

#### Security Impact

An attacker can utilize this domain _info.hacker.one_ for targeting the organization by fake login hackerOne forms, or steal sensitive information of teams  (credentials, credit card information, etc)

#### FIX & MITIGATION

*You should immediately remove the DNS-entry for this domain or point it elsewhere if you don't use that service
*Contact vendor asap for patch or launch a Fix


Please let me know if more info needed or any help,

Best Regards,
@ak1t4
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:

Hi team,i've been able to takeover subdomain at info.hacker.one,
the CNAME entry in the subdomain is pointing to an external page service (app.unbounce.com).

Actual Dns Entry:

Steps To Reproduce

1) I have claimed the domain and placed a page for PoC validation located under:
Go to -> http://info.hacker.one/blank-page-123133617adasdasdsa/
2) You see the alert box and the subdomain takeover

Private & hide Video PoC at -> https://youtu.be/IcoGM65YyU4

How was this possible?

While testing UnbouncePage services i saw that they block any domain that was already claimed, but i decided go deeper and I found an 0day in their API which allows any user to claim any domain with a DNS entry pointing to -> unbouncepages.com, i think this bug compromises All Customers Domains at UnbouncePage Services

Security Impact

An attacker can utilize this domain info.hacker.one for targeting the organization by fake login hackerOne forms, or steal sensitive information of teams (credentials, credit card information, etc)

FIX & MITIGATION

*You should immediately remove the DNS-entry for this domain or point it elsewhere if you don't use that service
*Contact vendor asap for patch or launch a Fix

Please let me know if more info needed or any help,

Best Regards,
@ak1t4

activities.message:
Hi @ak1t4,

We can confirm your submission and your proof-of-concept.

Have you already reached out to Unbounce at all to inform them of the issue? If not, can you provide more details on how you were able to add our existing subdomain to Unbounce's systems?

We've reached out to them to start the conversation, and we hope to add them to this report as soon as we hear back.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @ak1t4,

We can confirm your submission and your proof-of-concept.

Have you already reached out to Unbounce at all to inform them of the issue? If not, can you provide more details on how you were able to add our existing subdomain to Unbounce's systems?

We've reached out to them to start the conversation, and we hope to add them to this report as soon as we hear back.

activities.message:
Hey @ak1t4,

We're in touch with Unbounce who are now working with their security team on mitigating this issue. Thanks again for the report!

Cheers!
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @ak1t4,

We're in touch with Unbounce who are now working with their security team on mitigating this issue. Thanks again for the report!

Cheers!

activities.message:
Hi @reed and @asuka thanks for the fast reply,

I didn't contact with unbouncePages yet, here the reproduction steps and POC to bypass the domain branded links filter:

#### Reproduction Steps & POC:

1)Create a subscription to unbounce page service at app.unbounce.com
2)Go to CREATE NEW PAGE as example /pages/new , put anything into & Save it
3)Go to “CHANGE URL” option and fill /path with anything. Use any domain added or unbounce default domain
4)Intercept request with burp or another proxy
5) Change the page%5Bdomain%5D=  with any domain like www.google.com.ar and send the request

POST __/2235922/pages/9bda16ba-2daa-4d89-8079-8333cab3b44f/url/confirm_or_update__ HTTP/1.1
Host: app.unbounce.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.10; rv:51.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/51.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: es-ES,es;q=0.8,en-US;q=0.5,en;q=0.3
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br
X-NewRelic-ID: XQQAUl9ADAQFV1hW
X-CSRF-Token: LCxzkqezPgCh0hQHk1H9UNaR4VddPCUbvG9wC+DKS3E=
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Referer: https://app.unbounce.com/2235922/pages/9bda16ba-2daa-4d89-8079-8333cab3b44f
Content-Length: 183
Cookie: ….

utf8=%E2%9C%93&_method=put&authenticity_token=LCxzkqezPgCh0hQHk1H9UNaR4VddPCUbvG9wC%2BDKS3E%3D&page%5Bdomain%5D=unbouncepages.com&page%5Bpath%5D=blank-page-123133617adasdasdsa43242311

change from "=unbouncepages.com" to "=www.google.com.ar" or any domain

utf8=%E2%9C%93&_method=put&authenticity_token=LCxzkqezPgCh0hQHk1H9UNaR4VddPCUbvG9wC%2BDKS3E%3D&page%5Bdomain%5D=www.google.com.ar&page%5Bpath%5D=blank-page-123133617adasdasdsa43242311

6) You see an error, close the tab an refresh page, and you see the url changed with the new domain and page "created" and linked over that domain

(*This works with any domain and affects all branded domains with DNS entries pointed to unbouncepages.com)

Here a Private & Hide video PoC showing  all the above explained -> https://youtu.be/YsEXZ-SpHsc

Let me know if is anything more needed,

Regards,
@ak1t4

activities.message:
Hi all,

I'm the Head of Security for Unbounce.  Thank you everyone for notifying us and providing a POC.  We're jumping on this quickly.  Our engineering team is in the process of fixing this issue.

Hi all,

I'm the Head of Security for Unbounce. Thank you everyone for notifying us and providing a POC. We're jumping on this quickly. Our engineering team is in the process of fixing this issue.

activities.message:
Thank you @ak1t4.

I really appreciate you keeping up the attention on this case.  We are aware of the scope and urgency of this issue.  A fix for this issue is expected today (Tues).
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you @ak1t4.

I really appreciate you keeping up the attention on this case. We are aware of the scope and urgency of this issue. A fix for this issue is expected today (Tues).

activities.message: I'm curious @ak1t4, how were you able to get the list of affected domains?  Are you brute-forcing DNS subdomains from some sort of customer list?
activities.markdown_message: I'm curious @ak1t4, how were you able to get the list of affected domains? Are you brute-forcing DNS subdomains from some sort of customer list?

activities.message:
hI @ubscott , 

No, You can use some tools or online tools  to do that,  knowing the Unbounce-page server IP we can do a reverse DNS (rDNS) and the list of domains shows up:

Like example:
1) Detect the Ip server for example this 54.225.142.127 
2) Reverse DNS -> tell us the number of domains who managed that server as example:

####           IP	                       Nº Domains
####     54.225.142.127	            (56)

And the list :

lp.nutrex-hawaii.com	2014-03-02
www.21stcenturysharelord.com.au	2014-03-02
www.landbanking.com.au	2014-03-02
programs.bsl-lausanne.ch	2014-03-01
services.socialsafe.net	2014-03-01
cloud.itduzzit.com	2014-02-28
resources.zafin.com	2014-02-28
specials.liveplan.com	2014-02-28
www.lovi3g.ru	2014-02-28
....

We can confirm that this domains are managed by unbouncepages.com looking where they points
 as example:

skynet-localhost:Desktop ak1t4_hax0r$ __host__ lp.nutrex-hawaii.com
__lp.nutrex-hawaii.com__ is an alias for __unbouncepages.com__
unbouncepages.com has address 52.54.171.94
unbouncepages.com has address 52.54.211.97

Click in this link and you see all this data here -> https://www.threatcrowd.org/ip.php?ip=54.225.142.127
(ip's,domains and the topology, networking and linked nodes)

Let me know if need anything else,

Regards,
@ak1t4

activities.message:
Sorry for the delay, @ubscott and @ak1t4! My apologies for letting this one hang.

I'm resolving it, as Unbounce has corrected the issue, and we'll be making our bounty decision shortly. :)
activities.markdown_message:
Sorry for the delay, @ubscott and @ak1t4! My apologies for letting this one hang.

I'm resolving it, as Unbounce has corrected the issue, and we'll be making our bounty decision shortly. :)

activities.message:
Hi @ak1t4,

While this is a vulnerability in a third-party service (Unbounce), we had started using for a few marketing landing pages as a test, so we greatly appreciate the report to make sure that any services and systems we use are protected. Note that no HackerOne data was affected by this issue, as this is on a separate domain (hacker.one vs hackerone.com).

We'd like to thank you for providing a simple PoC that made this issue to validate, while not impacting any user-facing content.

Thanks for the report, and happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @ak1t4,

While this is a vulnerability in a third-party service (Unbounce), we had started using for a few marketing landing pages as a test, so we greatly appreciate the report to make sure that any services and systems we use are protected. Note that no HackerOne data was affected by this issue, as this is on a separate domain (hacker.one vs hackerone.com).

We'd like to thank you for providing a simple PoC that made this issue to validate, while not impacting any user-facing content.

Thanks for the report, and happy hacking!

Thanks for the bounty :)

Kind Regards,
@ak1t4
